Transcription-Unit.comment:
sdsN is induced during stationary phase at low temperature or with preferred nitrogen sources through the Crl and NarP transcription factors, respectively [Hao16]. SdsN represses genes involved in the metabolism of oxidized nitrogen compounds. In addition, sdsN confers resistance to nitrofurans through repression of nfsA [Hao16].

Several transcripts were detected in the tcyN-sdiA intergenic region during stationary phase. The two most prominent bands were approximately 180 nt (SdsN178) and 140 nt long (SdsN137) and shared the same Rho-independent terminator. Another band was identified and shown to be a processed transcript of approximately 120 nt (SdsN124) [Hao16].

The Hfq chaperone binds to SdsN178, SdsN137, and SdsN124 with different affinities [Hao16].

SdsN178

SdsN178 overproduction affected one mRNA, casA, which showed a 2-fold increase and only partial of nfsA, hmpA, and narP. The 5'-end sequence of SdsN178 is extremely AU rich [Hao16].

SdsN137

SdsN137 is transcribed from a σS-dependent promoter. Overexpression regulates negatively four mRNAs related to the metabolism of and response to nitrogen compounds: nfsA, hmpA, ybjC, and the response regulator narP. Other transcripts are regulated by SdsN137 and do not fall into a single category: cya, uraA, inaA, and rluA are downregulated and fliC and ymfT are upregulated. nfsA, hmpA, and narP were identified as base pairs directly regulated by SdsN137 [Hao16]. The SdsN137 transcript could be also a processed transcript, since it is within the sdsN gene. There, a Rho-independent terminator with the absolute cordinates 1997022 to 1997057 falls within the sdsN gene.

SdsN124

SdsN124 is a processed form from SdsN178 and SdsN137 transcripts and accumulates maximally after 20 h of growth in M63 glucose medium. SdsN124 represses nfsA and hmpA [Hao16].

Publication.title: Protection against deleterious nitrogen compounds: role of σS-dependent small RNAs encoded adjacent to sdiA.
Publication.author: Hao Y
Updegrove TB
Livingston NN
Storz G

Publication.title: Genome-wide detection of novel regulatory RNAs in E. coli.
Publication.author: Raghavan R
Groisman EA
Ochman H

Evidence-Code.comment: The length of the (transcribed) RNA is experimentally determined. The length of the mRNA is compared with that of the DNA sequence and by this means the number of genes transcribed are established.

Sites or genes bounding the transcription unit are experimentally identified. Several possible cases exist, such as defining the boundaries of a transcription unit with an experimentally identified promoter and terminator, or with a promoter and a downstream gene that is transcribed in the opposite direction, or with a terminator and an upstream gene that is transcribed in the opposite direction.

Promoter.comment: When σS is deleted, expression from the sdsNp2 promoter is significantly reduced; however, this promoter contains a sequence that partially matches the consensus σS promoter sequence. The protein CRL, which stimulates σS binding to RNA polymerase, appears to influence expression from this promoter [Hao16]

Evidence-Code.common-name: Inferred by a human based on computational evidence
Evidence-Code.comment: Human inference. A curator or author inferred this assertion after review of one or more possible types of computational evidence such as sequence similarity, recognized motifs or consensus sequence, etc. When the inference was made by a computer in an automated fashion, use EV-AINF.
The transcription start site is identified by primer extension.
A person inferred, or reviewed a computer inference of, promoter position relative to the -10 and -35 boxes.

IEP inferred from expression pattern.
The assertion was inferred from a pattern of expression data such as
  • Transcript levels (e.g. Northerns, microarray data)
  • Protein levels (e.g. Western blots)
